column4: ugh hurry up already! all this is doing is waste time and disk space
is there anything in there about upgrading from i686 to AMD64
you have to do a complete reinstall in order to switch from 32-bit to 64-bit
yes
it's named after a vehicular transmission
which is often controlled via a stick shift
just wait for the packages to finish installing
check uname -m
it printed: x86-64
that is the amd64 version
how did you install it?
how are you starting it?
try running it as firefox-3.5
it doesn't replace the existing firefox package
firefox 3.5
shiretoko is the development codename for firefox 3.5
it is EXACTLY the same except for different branding
you may want to go to about:config and change general.useragent.extra.firefox to Firefox/3.5.2
ctrl+alt+f1 switches you to tty1
you can switch back to X with ctrl+alt+f7
the windowing system
it manages the graphical display
it's also known as X11.  ubuntu uses Xorg as its X server
ctrl+alt+f7
